name: B. Pashmak and Flowers
statement:
Pashmak decided to give Parmida a pair of flowers from the garden. There
are flowers in the garden and the -th of them has a beauty number .
Parmida is a very strange girl so she doesn’t want to have the two most
beautiful flowers necessarily. She wants to have those pairs of flowers
that their beauty difference is maximal possible!Your task is to write a
program which calculates two things: The maximum beauty difference of
flowers that Pashmak can give to Parmida. The number of ways that
Pashmak can pick the flowers. Two ways are considered different if and
only if there is at least one flower that is chosen in the first way and
not chosen in the second way.
editorial:
If all numbers are equal then answer will be , otherwise the answer will
be , where is the number of our maximum elements and is the number of
our minimum elements. Total complexity : Sample solution: 7495202
